name: Mexican Food in the United States Multiple Choice Quiz | Hobbies | 10 Questions

questions.text: This is a flat Mexican bread, made from flour or corn, used to make many Mexican dishes.
questions.explanation:
Tortilla.

	The best tortillas (hard to get!) are handmade.

questions.text: A filling of meat, beans or other ingredients, wrapped in a large, soft flour tortilla.
questions.explanation:
Burrito.

	Burritos can be made of many things, from beans to scallops.

questions.text: A spicy brown sauce made from many ingredients, including chile, bread crumbs, and chocolate.
questions.explanation:
Mole.

	There are many different kinds of mole.

questions.text: A flour (sometimes corn) tortilla folded in half and filled with melted cheese.
questions.explanation:
Quesadilla.

	The name means "little cheesy one."

questions.text: Soft corn tortillas rolled around a filling of meat or cheese and baked with a special sauce.
questions.explanation:
Enchiladas.

	Enchilada sauce is usually not extremely spicy, but is based on dried chiles.

questions.text: Corn tortilla chips covered with melted cheese.
questions.explanation:
Nachos.

	The cheese may be real cheese or a processed sauce.

questions.text: A deep-fried pastry stick, rolled in sugar and served hot.
questions.explanation:
Churro.

	Churros can be bought from mobile carts in some areas.

questions.text: A cold drink made from rice and almonds.
questions.explanation:
Horchata.

	Horchata sold in restaurants is likely to be composed more of chemicals than real rice and almonds!

questions.text: Corn tortillas rolled tightly around a meat or potato filling and deep-fried. Also called rolled tacos.
Which of these is a soup containing tripe.
questions.explanation:
Menudo.

	Many restaurants serve menudo on specific days, often Fridays.
